channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Los Angeles houses of worship plan for possible ICE Raids
item.description: Churches in Los Angeles put contingency plans in place after the Trump administration rescinds long-standing guidance advising immigration agents to avoid houses of worship.
item.content:encoded:
Churches in Los Angeles put contingency plans in place after the Trump administration rescinds long-standing guidance advising immigration agents to avoid houses of worship.

(Image credit: Jason DeRose)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: 'Love Island USA' might decenter whiteness — but the show still won't face reality
item.description: The finale of Love Island USA airs Sunday night. Critic Aisha Harris says it's impossible to separate the season's racial and ethnic diversity from the show's mealy-mouthed handling of behind-the-scenes drama.
item.content:encoded:
The finale of Love Island USA airs Sunday night. Critic Aisha Harris says it's impossible to separate the season's racial and ethnic diversity from the show's mealy-mouthed handling of behind-the-scenes drama.

(Image credit: Kim Nunneley)
item.dc:creator: Aisha Harris

item.title: Folklife stars: Maya artist, Bolivian rappers, Dolly Parton's guitar restorer
item.description: They all showed off their talents at this year's Smithsonian Folklife Festival. The theme: How youth keep cultural traditions alive.
item.content:encoded:
They all showed off their talents at this year's Smithsonian Folklife Festival. The theme: How youth keep cultural traditions alive.

(Image credit: Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Michal Ruprecht

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza kill at least 19, hospitals say, as ceasefire talks drag on
item.description: Israeli strikes in the Gaza Strip killed at least 19 people on Sunday, including six children at a water collection point, local health officials said.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli strikes in the Gaza Strip killed at least 19 people on Sunday, including six children at a water collection point, local health officials said.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Panicking': Why recent college grads are struggling to find jobs
item.description: Recent college graduates are facing one of the most challenging job markets in years — with the exception of the pandemic period — even as the overall unemployment rate remains low.
item.content:encoded:
Recent college graduates are facing one of the most challenging job markets in years — with the exception of the pandemic period — even as the overall unemployment rate remains low.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: The biggest piece of Mars on Earth is going up for auction in New York
item.description: Sotheby's in New York will be auctioning the largest piece of Mars ever found on Earth.
item.content:encoded:
Sotheby's in New York will be auctioning the largest piece of Mars ever found on Earth.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Camp Mystic asked to remove buildings from government flood maps despite risk
item.description: The data also highlights critical risks in other areas along the Guadalupe River in Kerr County, and nationwide as many Americans have a flood risk they are not aware of.
item.content:encoded:
The data also highlights critical risks in other areas along the Guadalupe River in Kerr County, and nationwide as many Americans have a flood risk they are not aware of.

(Image credit: RONALDO SCHEMIDT)
item.dc:creator: Laura Sullivan

item.title: Is the FIFA Club World Cup final a barometer of soccer's success in America?
item.description: President Trump will be at the final game in the FIFA Club World Cup, taking place Sunday. Paul Tenorio of The Athletic talks about this moment in the culture and business of soccer in America.
item.content:encoded: President Trump will be at the final game in the FIFA Club World Cup, taking place Sunday. Paul Tenorio of The Athletic talks about this moment in the culture and business of soccer in America.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: What happened when Grok praised Hitler
item.description: The Atlantic Writer Charlie Warzel on his new reporting about Elon Musk, Grok and why a chatbot called for a new Holocaust.
item.content:encoded: The Atlantic Writer Charlie Warzel on his new reporting about Elon Musk, Grok and why a chatbot called for a new Holocaust.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Poland's Iga Świątek thrashes American Amanda Anisimova in Wimbledon women's final
item.description: The Polish player emerged victorious after less than an hour of gameplay.
item.content:encoded:
The Polish player emerged victorious after less than an hour of gameplay.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise
